intro: Paederia cruddasiana subsp. microcarpa, commonly known as the small-fruited paederia, is a member of the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and trifoliate leaves with serrated margins. The flowers are small and white, clustered in umbels, and the fruits are small, berry-like capsules. It is native to tropical regions of Asia and is often found in moist, shaded habitats. The plant has limited commercial use but is of interest in botanical studies due to its unique morphology and ecological role.
